byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MERNA THOMAS

abstract: Egyptian Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi enacts counterterrorism law that allows security officers more immunity from prosecution, penalizes journalists if they contradict any official statements about militant attacks and expands surveillance powers of state.
lead_paragraph: President Abdel-Fattah el-Sisi issued the new law on Sunday to combat a wave of militant attacks, but critics say it merely protects repressive practices already in use.

headline.main: Egypt Widens Government Power With New Anti-Terrorism Law
headline.print_headline: Egypt Expands State Power With a New Security Law

snippet: President Abdel-Fattah el-Sisi issued the new law on Sunday to combat a wave of militant attacks, but critics say it merely protects repressive practices already in use.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
